intro: Diplostephium ellipticum, commonly known as the elliptic spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are elliptical in shape, with a glossy green surface and a hairy underside. The flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia.
